content.description: Climb easy terrain up a short wall.   Note: Currently, all lead/belay hangers   have been removed by the FA party.
content.protection: 2 bolts, 2 bolt anchor.  LEAD HANGERS HAVE BEEN REMOVED.

content.description:
From the guidebook: 

  Climb the mini-buttress at the base of DC#1. The first bolt may look easier to get than it is. Traverse in from the right. There are variant paths to the 2nd bolt: coming up right from the first bolt  through the huecos)is easier, and more secure, than coming up from its left side. From a stance below the mini-hang, figure out how to  purchase, and leverage, the cool scoop-cup-like hold, and keep it together until rim holds come to the rescue.

From the guidebook: 

  Climb the mini-prowl with a crack-like seam.   Interesting features lurk. Its steeper than it   looks. The high first bolt is high, and   committing to get.

Medium or long sling recommended on bolt 1 to avoid rope drag higher up. 10d/11a crux passing bolts 2 and 3, turning the lip of the roof and pulling onto the face above. Reachy with technical footwork. Stay right of bolt 3 and look for the horizontal finger slot right of the vertical seam. Stand up to classic layback at bolt 4 and then follow square holds on easier rock to the anchor.
content.protection: Four protection bolts to equalized two-bolt rap/lower/toprope anchor.
content.location: N.T.B. is just left of Tailgate Party, on the front or river side of the arete at the right end of the wall. Start just left of the small oak tree next to the trail. Climb onto the dusty ledge below an overhang with large holes and clip bolt 1. Turn the roof and climb the face above staying slightly right of the bolts and left of the arete.

content.description: Well protected route with a great angle.  Short, powerful, and fun.  Bouldering on a rope, POB style.

Above the break, climb the blocky steps   (high first bolt), angling right to the gray   face above. Pull up to the hole, stay low,   and traverse right to the belay, or, climb up   to the rim, and traverse to the belay. Its   better low.

(4 routes from 5.6 to 5.10d / primarily south   facing)   This area is defined as the short and   broken walls located upstream (left when   facing the bluff) of DC#1. The first, and   namesake route, comes into view on a   sunny mini-buttress at the base of DC#1.   Routes are described from left (upstream)   to right (downstream) when facing the bluff.
